com.sessionm.api
Class SessionM

java.lang.Object
  com.sessionm.api.SessionM

public class SessionM
extends Object

Session M service interface.

Basic API usage.

Following is the basic pattern of integrating Session M service within your application code:

1. Start the service by calling startSession(Context, String) . Note that you will need to obtain a valid application ID from session M. The best place to call this method is in Application.onCreate() - this ensures that Session M service is managed in one place regardless of which application activity is started with.
2. Ensure that each Activity that can present SessionM UI notifies SessionM service about its lifecycle. This can be accomplished in two ways: a. By having application Activity extend BaseActivity class. b. By calling lifecycle methods onActivityStart(Activity), onActivityResume(Activity), onActivityPause(Activity) and onActivityStop(Activity) in corresponding methods of the Activity: Activity.onStart(), Activity.onResume(), Activity.onPause() and Activity.onStop().
3. Log actions in appropriate places in your code using logAction(String) call. Make sure to use action name as defined in developer portal.
4. Present SessionM UI using presentActivity(ActivityType, Object...).

Session M UI Activities.

SessionM presents achievements and other information, such as user portal or SessionM program introduction via UI activity API - presentActivity(ActivityType, Object...). Achievement activities become available as a result of action logging. User portal and program introduction activities are always available for display. Note that depending on the type of the Session M activity the UI may be presented either in application Activity that is currently displayed by addiong SessionM View to it or by launching a separate Activity. Started session is required for Session M activities display.

Threading.

SessionM class is thread-safe and can be invoked from any thread. Note that listener callback methods for ActivityListener and SessionListener are not called on the UI thread, so, if application performs UI operations in those methods it needs to ensure it does so in the UI thread.
